organizations: National Football Foundation and College Hall of Fame
lead_paragraph: Lou Holtz, the only coach to lead six programs to bowl games, was named to the National Football Foundation and College Hall of Fame. Holtz coached 36 seasons (1969-2004) at William and Mary, North Carolina State, Arkansas, Minnesota, Notre Dame and South Carolina. The only other coach selected was John Cooper, who spent 24 seasons (1977-2000) at Tulsa, Arizona State and Ohio State.
